section.title: Bond Types
section.para: A bond between atoms is of one of the following types:

row.entry: Special case, never assigned to an actual bond but used in bond-matching functions
An aromatic bond, assigned automatically by the atom typing routines

section.title: Cell Types
section.para: A model's unit cell is, at any given time, one of the following:

row.entry: The model has no unit cell (i.e. it is non-periodic)
The model's unit cell is cubic, with A=B=C and alpha=beta=gamma=90
The model's unit cell is an orthorhombus, with any cell lengths and alpha=beta=gamma=90
The model's unit cell is monoclinic or triclinic, with any cell lengths and angles

listitem.para: Cell Commands for methods to set and manipulate unit cells of models
Unitcell type for information on the relevant variable type

row.entry: Atoms and connected bonds are coloured according to their charge
Atoms and connected bonds are coloured according to their element
Atoms and connected bonds are coloured according to the force acting on the atom
Atoms and connected bonds are coloured according to the velocities of the atoms

listitem.para: Atom Commands for methods to create and edit atoms

section.title: Drawing Styles
section.para: Available drawing styles for individual atoms are:

row.entry: Atoms and connected bonds are drawn using simple lines
Atoms and connected bonds are drawn using 'capped' cylinders
Atoms and connected bonds are drawn using spheres and cylinders, with all atoms the same size
Atoms and connected bonds are drawn using spheres and cylinders, with all atoms sized according to their atomic radius set in the preferences
An ellipsoid, oriented by face and edge vectors
An ellipsoid, oriented by an explicit set of provided axes
An arrow centred on a point and pointing along a specified local vector

section.title: Label Types
section.para: Valid label types are as follows:

row.entry: Atomic charge currently assigned to the atom
Forcefield equivalent name from the assigned forcefield atom type (or the forcefield atom type name if no equivalent applies)
Assigned forcefield atom type name (if any)

section.para: Valid output types (or debug modes) are as follows:

row.entry: Enable output of all types listed in this table

Debug OpenGL calls and graphics capabilities as best as is possible
Debug file-reading and argument parsing routines
Print (lots of) information regarding setting and matching of atom type descriptions
Enable a little extra output (but not much)

section.para: These options determine how general parsing of plain text files proceeds, as well as controlling delimited argument parsing.

Normal parentheses are automatically stripped from the input file
Treat backslash as a normal character

section.title: View Objects
section.para: Any combination of the following 'bit' values may be summed into a single integer and given to the 'screenobjects' or 'offscreenobjects' preferences members to determine exactly what is drawn on and off screen (i.e. to bitmap images).

row.entry: Atoms and bonds in the model
The unit cell of the model, if any
Cell axes at the corner of the unit cell (if displayed)
